fields.summary: Heartbeat URL Doesn't Match Output for euca-describe-services/euca-describe-components
fields.environment:
*non-HA*

* multi-cluster, Managed mode
* one cluster SC SAN (Equallogic); other cluster SC Overlay (tgtd)

comments.body: Raising priority since this is the recomended way to check the health of the cloud (per our documentation) and it causes confusion if it is not reliable.

Code Review Request : EUCA-7948 Heartbeat URL Doesn't Match Output for euca-describe-services/euca-describe-components

branch : dev/mmunn1/EUCA-7948 

diff :  git show --color a42f1cab6c2825d100c643d754bb0893e9b2558e

Summary: euca-describe-components shows uninitialized compoments with no useful information and this is confusing for 
         customers when they compare this output to euca-describe-services and Heartbeat URL

Solution: Do not dislay uninitialized compoments with no information in euca-describe-components/

Unit test : described in comments, I have created a Eutester testcase for this issue at: /eutester/testcases/cloud_admin/4-0/EUCA-7948
[~sjones], would you please code review [~mmunn1]'s suggested fix.
[~mmunn1], I assume this is for 4.1. The change looks OK, but did you investigate why there are primordial components? What about the other reported issues?

[~sjones] Yes this is for 4.1. I am not seeing the node issue in 4.1 as the correct status is being displayed.  The primordial components show up in the Components.list without a LocalService I am not sure why but I felt that this was the least intrusive way to resolve this.

The reporting of components with no enabled service appears intentional and allows the administrator to identify registration issues. It would be useful if the output of euca-describe-components included the type for primordial components as the current output does not clearly identify what they are.

I don't think it is a correct expectation that the output of euca-describe-services and euca-describe-components is the same in this regard.
[~sjones] I will look into adding the type for primordial components as I agree that with out it the output is pretty much useless.
[~mmunn1], the euca-describe-components output formatting should probably be a separate issue and may not be important for 4.1.
[~sjones] I will file a separate issue for the euca-describe-components output formatting .
